trans-unit.source: Introducing DocumentDB - A NoSQL Database for Microsoft Azure | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Introducing DocumentDB - A NoSQL Database for Microsoft Azure | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Download a whitepaper by David Chappell about DocumentDB, a managed NoSQL database on Azure.
trans-unit.target: Download a whitepaper by David Chappell about DocumentDB, a managed NoSQL database on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Introducing DocumentDB - A NoSQL Database for Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Introducing DocumentDB - A NoSQL Database for Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Not sure if DocumentDB is right for your application or data?
trans-unit.target: Not sure if DocumentDB is right for your application or data?

trans-unit.source: Want to learn about how JSON data is stored and accessed in DocumentDB?
trans-unit.target: Want to learn about how JSON data is stored and accessed in DocumentDB?

trans-unit.source: If so, this introductory whitepaper by David Chappell is a good place to start.
trans-unit.target: If so, this introductory whitepaper by David Chappell is a good place to start.

trans-unit.source: It discusses how you can benefit from the flexibility that schema-free JSON data provides, enabling you to handle changes to data structure effortlessly.
trans-unit.target: It discusses how you can benefit from the flexibility that schema-free JSON data provides, enabling you to handle changes to data structure effortlessly.

trans-unit.source: The whitepaper also walks you through the following:
trans-unit.target: The whitepaper also walks you through the following:

trans-unit.source: Using the DocumentDB data model to store JSON data in documents and collections within a database.
trans-unit.target: Using the DocumentDB data model to store JSON data in documents and collections within a database.

trans-unit.source: Working with your data by using the client libraries, the RESTful access methods, or DocumentDB SQL.
trans-unit.target: Working with your data by using the client libraries, the RESTful access methods, or DocumentDB SQL.

trans-unit.source: Running logic from the database itself by writing stored procedures (sprocs), triggers, or user defined functions (UDFs) and storing them in the collection.
trans-unit.target: Running logic from the database itself by writing stored procedures (sprocs), triggers, or user defined functions (UDFs) and storing them in the collection.

trans-unit.source: Choosing a consistency option to meet the reliability and performance needs of your application.
trans-unit.target: Choosing a consistency option to meet the reliability and performance needs of your application.

trans-unit.source: Selecting a pricing option based on your throughput requirements.
trans-unit.target: Selecting a pricing option based on your throughput requirements.

trans-unit.source: PDF Download: Introducing DocumentDB - A NoSQL Database for Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: PDF Download: Introducing DocumentDB - A NoSQL Database for Microsoft Azure
